text: Hey <@U026PLK4S> <@U0260V1BX> <@U0260V4K1>. When choosing the name of a project's location and artist's hometown in the CMS, is the plan to give them a list of countries to choose from, or just accept any string they want?
we havent really discussed this with them, but i would think the latter
I’d probably say any string
Cool. And does Artist's Location = Project's Location ?
or the other way around, or maybe they can differ?
i think they said that the nature of their grants, is that both are connected
yes, i would say they are the same
Okay, I remember them saying that but wanted to make sure we didn't want to give them control over it anyway
ah. good call.
yeah part of me deep down still feels like we should give them that control

but i think its overkill if they are in fact the same. I think the one scenario where I could see differentiation taking place is, assigning a country for the project, and getting more specific with the artist location
like this project is about syria. photographer is from damascus
Is there any issue with going ahead and giving them control over both? Worst case they have to type the same word twice in the CMS
<@U0260V4K1> <@U026PLK4S> thoughts?
we could build out two fields and confirm with them. we can always hide one later right?
sorry, i’m of two minds on this
When they assign an artist to a project in the CMS, the project's location form field could default to that artist's location but stay editable?
<@U0260V1BX> yes
thats a good call
yeah i like that approach jenny. but i would do switch the order. give location for a project and then autofill the artist location
design for the most regular case, but bake in an option to change it
so - on our last call didn’t they say the location of the photographer is the location of the project?
ultimately, I’m fine with either
yes, but countries are big.
i don’t think it’s a huge problem, but i like the affordance that’s built in.
like, maybe the socotra island projects location is Yemen, but the artist is actually from socotra island.
i dont know. i could go either way too but yeah i like the flexibility
as long as it doesn’t bring up any design issues, I’m fine with whatever
:thumbsup: i'll do two separate, editable fields that default to being the same
thanks jenny!
hey <@U026PLK4S>, do you have an asset for the map you could send my way? I know there's a chance it will change but even a placeholder would be helpful.
